title: Conventional PR doesn't work on forked repository
prompt: Conventional PR doesn't work on a forked repository, even though the action workflow is valid by listening to the `pull_request` event and the user is already a collaborator to the repository
completion: Change the event target from `pull_request` to `pull_request_target` which is made specifically for forked repositories

title: Conventional PR is throwing errors

title: Conventional PR false alarm

completion: Use `commit_pattern` configuration instead of `title_pattern` to validate commit messages.

title: Conventional PR issue requirement bypass
prompt: User is convinced that Conventional PR issue linking requirement feature can be bypassed by simply typing #<number> in the pull request body
completion: This is wrong because Conventional PR use the GitHub magic keywords for issue linking if it's not directly linked by the pull request author. If GitHub API returns no linked issues, then the pull request is considered to be invalid.
